title: Reading Lila - An Inquiry into Morals - By Robert M. Pirsig - Chapter 23
description: Lila, living as always through her immediate needs, realizes she can evoke reality like magic and begins to encounter some curious visitors from her past...

transcript_parts.text: hi there i'm going to read chapter 23 of
lila an inquiry into morals by robert m
percy
it seemed to lila that all this was some
kind of dream she was in
where did it start she couldn't remember
her mind always went faster and faster
like this when she got scared
why did you have to take the pills out
of her purse the pills could have made
it not so scary
he must have thought those pills were
dope or something that's why he took
them
she could tell when she needed them by
how scary everything got
now she needed them bad she should have
got her suitcase
this afternoon like she was going to
then she wouldn't have to go back to the
boat like this
now it was dark that damn waiter he

then she could have taken a cap now she

but she hadn't lied
and he knew she hadn't lied he could

he had to make it look like she had done

it was so cold now the wind went right

the streets were so dirty here
everything is dirty here everything was

it was starting to rain she didn't even
know

when she looked down a street she could

maybe her directions got twisted and she

there was a park maybe she could just

she saw one coming with its light off
she thought about waving to it but she

in the old days she would have done it

but she was so tired now she didn't want

maybe she should ask somebody for some

not here it was dangerous going up to

but they'd find out about her in this

you don't want to see them again she

she didn't think she'd like it down
there she'd just stay up
until she saw where the marina might be
then she'd cross

10 or 15 years ago he would have been in

she used to say when you don't need them
they're all over the place but when you

she wondered where ali was now she must

that's what lila was going to be a bag

the rain was getting her hair so wet she
must be looking like a witch too
there was supposed to be a big castle
with a high green steeple at the top

that's what she remembered when she got
to the castle
she should turn down to the river and
that's where the boat should be
she remembered that from when they left
her shoes were getting all squishy
like her clothes and this box of shirts
maybe she should just stop walking and

but then she wouldn't get to the castle
until she got to the castle there was
nowhere to stop why didn't she ever
learn not to get mad at people
you always think someone's going to come

some nice man's gonna come along and

you always think that don't you but
they're all gone now
lila the captain was the last one
there won't be any more lila he was the

that's what the one in the window was
telling her these shirts she bought for
the captain were getting all wet
he wouldn't even pay her for them now
maybe if she could stand in a doorway or

the bag they were in that would have

then she could take the shirts back to

but she needed a taxi to get back to the

the receipt was in the billfold maybe

no they wouldn't maybe there'll be some

she could just go in and look through

but then she remembered she couldn't get

she didn't have the combination she'd

but then if he was there she couldn't

maybe he'd give her some money then no

he wouldn't give her anything maybe she

probably she passed the castle she'd

she didn't remember the name of the

she just thought it was in this

with all her things he was going to take

all her things everything she owned was

she didn't see any sign of the river she

he went right by it was getting quieter

it looked like a better neighborhood but

she must have gone too far she didn't

she should have stayed close to the

not at night some of the windows had

now she didn't know what she was going

she'd be on her way to florida now she

she could see how he got up tight the

she should have kept her mouth shut she

if you don't sneak around and say

they'll get you for that they'll make

if you ever dare breathe that you don't

as they pretend they hate you they can't

that's what they've got to have jamie

that's what he didn't like all she

he wanted to know all about her he said

what she really was like so she tried to

and see what happened jamie saw what he

he saw it right away you mustn't ever

they think you don't see if you tell

and then they really hate you then they

that's what they did in rochester but

that's why they said she was sick they
don't want to hear the truth if you tell

they'll try to do things to you her feet

she should take her shoes off and walk

it would feel good to walk barefoot she

than if she didn't see the river she

maybe she would take everything off she

she tried to stand under trees and she

she knew she would catch it at home and

and she sat down by a gutter with her

and just let the water pour all around

maybe she should sit down now no not

she put one hand against a sign post and

that felt better it felt good to walk in

she'd like to take everything off just
take everything off
then somebody would stop and help her
it's the clothes that make them think
you're not really there
if she took off all her clothes then

you'll never find happiness this way

her little pen eyes her mother was

there were only two things that made her

and thinking about how much better she

if you did something good she didn't say

you have to hate them and then pretend

now they had her going too that's how it

just dirty you so you'll be like them

and then say look lila you're a

they want to mix you up just like they

and then they'll like you they'll say

you're really good they're the ones who

they don't know you lila nobody knows

but boy oh boy do you ever know them
they're always so calm afterwards that's

the minute before they come you're the

but the minute after you're just garbage
like the captain there
now he had had his fun now he just

now he's going to take his boat and his

there was no one else on the street here
but she had a feeling
somebody was watching her it seemed that
if she turned her head suddenly

what did she need to be scared of there

at least she wasn't going to get robbed

got all the new dresses

she saw a bee this morning on top of a

she wished she was at the island now her

and he used to make toast with the honey

she remembered he used to put it on a

then the funeral came and they sold his

lila never saw the bees again she used

and then sometimes they'd fly back and

and they always knew where her

that's what she thought about this

i told you you'll never find happiness
this way lila her mother had said
her face had that little smile she

i'm tired of hearing that mother lila

little pin eyes eyes eyes
her mother thought lila was going to

but the island when you went there it

you just went there it was in the

the wind came around the corner and blew

and blew something into her eyes like

or something she couldn't see she had to

there around the corner of the building
she saw it it was following her
she concentrated on it and concentrated

she really was a witch because slowly

she could make things come to her but
now

that was following her
it was just a dog as soon as the dog saw

it disappeared back behind the building
she concentrated some more
after a while slowly it started to come

she didn't move but held her eyes on it

it came toward her by the time it was

she saw who it was it was lucky after

oh lucky you've come back she said
you're all whole again
she started to walk toward him she

don't you know me lucky lila asked
you're all
whole again don't you remember me
it didn't show where he got hit by the

did you swim where is the island lucky
we must be getting close to it now
you show me the way but as soon as lyla

he was always smashing up somebody the

she shouldn't talk about somebody like

he looked at her like she was somebody

everybody acted like they were so sorry

they hated him just as much as she did

you shouldn't say that about dead people

she said it to him when he was alive no

it was the truth when she got around the

what a good dog he was always so good

it looked like something where the lions

and there were steps going out from the

and you didn't know who might be there
waiting she walked slowly
step by step she didn't hear anything

she took another step closer there was

she had to go past it she held her

it was all here oh it felt so good to be

she could hear the boat ropes going bing

bing in the wind at the gate for the

who said something to her but she

he kept waving his hands and pointing to

to the boat she walked down the dock
and there was the boat lucky had found
the way where was lucky
she looked for him and she didn't see
him she called but he didn't come
she looked into the river to see if he

but all she could see was lights far

after she stepped over the railing onto

oh it felt so good to sit down again her
teeth were chattering
and her clothes were all soaked all the

all she had to do was wait for the
captain and they would go to the island
a wake came across from somewhere out on

she could see it coming by the way the
lights moved from the on top of the
waves
it lifted up and rocked the boat against
the dock and then after a while it died
down
the water beside the boat was mucky
looking with a lot of junk in it
there were pieces of old plastic bottles
and dirty swirls of foam and a sponge
and some branches and a dead fish caught
on one side of the branches
the fish was turned up on its side and
was partly gone
then the fish and the branch moved on by
and she could smell the fish
then the branch came back again and the
whirlpool caught it
and it went down into the center of the
whirlpool and disappeared
the junk went round and round and round
in a whirlpool
it looked like the whirlpool was sucking
all the junk to the bottom of the river
she remembered watching some fish once
and how one of them kept
turning on its side and the others tried
to take bites out of it
then it straightened up again but after
a while it went over on its side again
and then it couldn't straighten up at
all then the other started to eat it
and it didn't struggle anymore she hoped
they wouldn't bite lucky when he swam
back to the island
when you slow down the fish eat you
alive you can't do anything
that makes them think you're slowing
down or they'll come after you
they wouldn't dare bite lucky she wished
the captain would come
she was so tired this side of the river
she'd even swim if she had to
she didn't know how long the captain

lila took off her sweater that felt

then she put her hand down into the

it was real warm in the river if she

she wouldn't be cold anymore she looked
at the water again
she didn't want to be cold anymore she
was so tired of fighting it
just to give up just to let go just to
let go
toward that hand in the water the hand
was sticking up
out of the water where the branch had

the hand came close to her and then a
little whirlpool in the water
carried it away it was like a baby's
hand
sticking out of the water a baby's hand
the little hand was reaching up out of
the water it was a baby's hand
she could see the little fingers the
hand was just further than she could
reach
going into the whirlpool then it came
closer and she caught it
and her heart held still as she brought

its little body was all stiff and cold
its eyes were closed
thank god she cleaned off the scum from

and saw that none of the babies seemed

it yet
but it was not breathing then she took
her sweater from the cockpit floor
and put it in her lap and wrap the baby
in it and held it close
and she rocked the baby back and forth
until she could feel some of the
coldness go out of it
it's all right she said it's all right
you're all right now
it's all over you're all right now no
one's going to hurt you anymore
after a while lila could feel the baby's

she began to rock it a little back and

that she remembered from long ago
